name: General Knowledge Quiz | Mixed 20 Questions | 20 Questions

questions.text: In what year did 'Operation Desert Storm' take place ?
An Isohyet is a line on a map joining places of equal what ?
Can you name the fictional detective who first appeared in print in 1893 and had rooms in Baker Street?
questions.explanation:
Sexton Blake.

	Sherlock Holmes made his debut in 1887.

questions.text: What is Barbie's surname ?
What regal figure of legend rode a horse named Spumador?
How many people were aboard the Ark?
If a cow moos and a cockerel crows, what does an ape do?
If you are a mancinist, what are you?
What does the J in Homer J. Simpson stand for ?
Who popularized the saying that there are 'lies, damned lies and statistics' ?
questions.explanation:
Mark Twain.

	It's a little unclear who said it first - it's been attributed to Disreali, and to Twain himself.

questions.text: Which great explorer's last words were 'I have not told you half of what I saw'?
Who popularised the expression 'The Iron Curtain' ?
The biggest pyramid in the world is in which country ?
questions.explanation:
Mexico.

	Pyramid of Quetzalcoatl at Cholula, outside Puebla, Mexico

questions.text: Born Arthur Jefferson in 1890, what was this comic better known as ?
The element helium got its name from...
options: it was discovered by a Greek Scientist from the town of Helius

questions.text: Copernicus was from which country?
The world record for the highest parachute jump was set in 1960. How high was the jump?
Which of the following is not a petroleum product?
What makes the blue colour in blue cheese?
How much does the Earth weigh in tons ?
